replies.msg:
Ramadani: the newest super agent behind Jovic deal


Jovic's agent is the co-founder of Lian Sports and has several high profile clients including Pjanic and Koulibaly as Real Madrid look to renovate their squad.

Real Madrid's signing of Luka Jovic introduces us to a new agent and one little-known prior to the deal: Fali Ramadani. In the last few months, the Albanian agent, has visited the offices of Real Madrid a number of times in an effort to solve the futures of his various clients. On the table during discussions with José Ángel Sánchez were Miralem Pjanic and Kalidou Koulibaly, two of his better known clients.

On Friday, As reported that Jovic will sign with Real Madrid for six seasons for €60 million with €42 million of that going to Eintracht Frankfurt, €9 million going to his parent club, Benfica and the other €9 million going to the author of the deal, Ramadani.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/05/04/football/1556964695_598236.html

Brazil coaches met with Marcelo, Casemiro and Vinicius on Friday

The Copa América is just around the corner and Brazil are scouting potential players to make the squad as they visited Real Madrid training on Friday.

Real Madrid have plenty of representatives playing at the Copa América for Brazil this summer. From the 14th of June until the 7th of July, Vinicius, Casemiro, Marcelo and Militao (who Real Madrid signed during the year and won't join until the summer) could all play in yellow during the summer and As have been told that members of the Brazil football federation visited their players in Valdebebas on Friday.

No Bale in Real Madrid's squad for the visit of Villarreal

Gareth Bale was whistled by his own fans the last time he played at the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu, but that won't happen this weekend as he is expected to be left out of Real Madrid's matchday squad against Villarreal.

Zinedine Zidane is set to leave the Welshman off a list that should include Vinicius, who is back from injury.

Modric: Real Madrid boss Zidane starting to have doubts

Zinedine Zidane is unhappy with Luka Modric's performances and is beginning to have doubts about the Croat's future at the LaLiga club.

Last week, Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane held a meeting with senior dressing-room figures as part of his attempts to turn Los Blancos' poor form around. Making plain his unhappiness at recent performances, he sought to stress the players' duty to give their all right to the end of the season.

It was a pep talk that had little to no effect, though: days later, Madrid slumped to a poor defeat at lowly Rayo Vallecano, and a visibly angry Zidane slammed his side's display in his post-match press conference.

Real Madrid forward Mariano Diaz was asked about his future after scoring twice in Sunday's 3-2 LaLiga win over Villarreal.

"I am very happy and let's see anything happens going forward."

"I am very happy for having won at home and on top of that, scoring," Diaz, who returned to Madrid from Lyon at the start of the season, added.

"We enjoyed it and the fans too, which is the important thing, even though the final score wasn't great.

"They netted but we were good too and we had the ball. We're very happy for the win and the fans received it well."

Real Madrid: James Rodríguez targeted by Ancelotti's Napoli

The on-loan Real Madrid midfielder seems unlikely to remain at Bayern Munich and is surplus to Zinedine Zidane's requirements, alerting former boss Carlo Ancelotti.

Speaking to Radio CRC, Italian sports journalist Stefano Agresti said that James could be among the type of player Ancelotti is looking at to push Napoli on and launch a major challenge to Juventus’ domestic stranglehold next season. Napoli president Aurelio de Laurentiis has previously stated his ambition to bring in some big-name signings this summer and Agresti provided a few possible targets.

https://en.as.com/en/2019/05/06/football/1557130282_682185.html

Marcos Llorente: Long-term problems at Real Madrid... And now: A sale or loan?


https://www.marca.com/en/football/real-madrid/2019/05/07/5cd15610468aebba4a8b4568.html

Bale's problem: Not wanted at Real Madrid, no offers and a salary of 17 million euros

Zinedine Zidane doesn't plan on having Gareth Bale at Real Madrid beyond the summer, and the club believe his cycle in the Spanish capital is over.

Bale earns 17 million euros per season and few clubs can meet those demands. Madrid expected Manchester United to come forward, but their failure to reach the Champions League will prevent that.

A return to Tottenham Hotspur has been suggested, but the Londoners aren't likely to be able to afford it.

Bayern Munich have been raised as a possibility at the Santiago Bernabeu as they look to renovate their squad and are planning to spend big this summer, but it's true that they've not shown any interest.

Real Madrid are growing frustrated over their failure to agree terms with Chelsea over a deal for Eden Hazard.

Talks between the two clubs began over a month ago for the Belgium international, who has just over a year left on his contract.

As Standard Sport revealed in February, Chelsea want in excess of £100m for the attacking midfielder even though he could leave for free in 2020.
